result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lauro Bergelio Sauca-Sarango
Current: 66 Terresa St, Roberts, WI 54023 United States  (Effective: 06-29-2022)
Prior: N8784 CTH 128, Spring Valley, WI 54767
Case set for today at 2:30 was not called or on the record. Attorney's agreed to set the matter for a PTC.
Pre-trial conference on August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Information filed with the Court and DE provided a copy. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court explains to DE that he needs to be making attorney fee payments at $100.00 per month. Court notes prints were completed. Court adjourned at 11:19 am.

11:03 AM Defendant Lauro Bergelio Sauca-Sarango appears in Court, Atty Shirlene Renee Perrin, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Mariana Kralewski. S/T. Court questions and reviews DE's rights. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH. The Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for further proceedings.

LANGUAGE: Spanish

STOP TIME: 11:19 am  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
per email from Marcy at DRC "We tried calling the number on his bond to get him scheduled for prints and photos and the number did not work. "
Shirlene Perrin

02:00 PM Defendant Lauro Bergelio Sauca-Sarango in court with attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin both via zoom.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 21CM140 and 21CF11.
 NAME OF PARTY NEEDING INTERPRETER:   Lauro Sauco Sarango
NAME OF INTERPRETER: Laura Salcido
AGENCY: Switz
LANGUAGE: spanish
ON-SITE OR TELEPHONE: zoom
START TIME: 2:00
STOP TIME: 2:20
Court swears in Ms. Salcido. ADA Walker: moves to dismiss 21CM140. Charges are now filed in 21CF11, proceed with initial on 21CF11. Atty Perrin agrees. Atty Perrin has a copy of complaint; Def does not. Court reviews DOB, address with Def.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. ADA Walker: $10,000 signature bond with absolute sobriety, not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. Atty Perrin: no objeciton. Court orders as requested. Preliminary hearing is scheduled. Court dismisses 21CM140. 2:19
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
